result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Juan Alfredo Garcia not in court - waived.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Juan Alfredo Garcia.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matters before the Court for statuses on all files.  Record by Atty. Renner who was just appointed and needs to get discovery, offer, and time to speak with her client. Court sets out about 60 days. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Juan Alfredo Garcia in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:12 p.m. Appearances made. Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Alfredo Garcia in court. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appears specially. Case to be re-assigned. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Surety bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Alfredo Garcia in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for Leah Selmek in court for Juan Alfredo Garcia. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Renner. Argument, granted. Future dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22CF153, 22CF231, 22CF104 & 22CM148.

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY SUSAN REYNOSA

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.C.H. AND S.L.M. OR RESIDENCE, NO CONTACT WITH K.F.W. (dob 6-14-1955) AND E.M.G. (dob 7-11-1984). Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defense Bond Motion

Defendant in court in custody via video with atty Leah Selmek. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM (6406) Defendant Juan Alfredo Garcia appeared by video.  Attorney Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Juan Alfredo Garcia. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Deputy Michael Genovese.
Michael Genovese duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by DDA Sempf. Witness identified the defendant on the video in court.
2:08PM - Cross examination by Attorney Selmek.
Evidence is closed.
2:11PM - Argument by DDA Sempf.
2:12PM - Argument by Attorney Selmek.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
adj. 2:12PM

records.addlTxt: Leah Selmek

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan Alfredo Garcia in court, in custody by video. Attorney Jason Daane for Attorney Selmek. Rights given and hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Amended signature bond file. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant Juan Alfredo Garcia appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Juan Alfredo Garcia. Called @ 1:49 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on 22CF153 and 22CF104 with 22CM148 on for adjourned initial appearance. Defendant also has new charges under 22GF361. Record by Atty. Selmek as to arraignment and enters not guilty pleas on all charges in 22CF153, 22CF104, and 22CM148. Further record by Atty. Selmek as to motion to modify bond - she has co-signor. Argument by the State who is objecting. Court addresses potential co-signor who is present in court - Taylor Disch. Response by the State who informs the Court that Ms. Disch is the victim in the Rock County Case and there is a no contact. Further discussion. Court denies motion to modify bond. Bond in other files to cover new charges in 22GF361. Atty. Selmek asks for date next week for initial appearance on new charges. Court sets all files as requested. Court in recess.
Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

**AMENDED ON 04-14-2022 TO ALSO COVER CHARGES IN 22GF361**
BOND TO COVER 22CF153, 22CM148 & 22CF104

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.C.H. AND S.L.M. OR RESIDENCE, NO CONTACT WITH K.F.W. (dob 6-14-1955) AND E.M.G. (dob 7-11-1984).
